th.title: Fundamental Docker
th.overview: The Fundamental Docker course is a learning experience about the basics of Docker, which is an efficient technology used for containerization. Participants will learn about Linux usage, basic Linux commands, working with the VIM text editor, and basic Docker operations including container creation, management, and the use of Docker Compose for orchestrating multiple services simultaneously.
objectives: To ensure participants understand the fundamentals of Docker and how containerization systems work.
To empower participants to efficiently utilize Docker for creating and managing containers.
To enable participants to use Docker Compose for orchestrating multiple services simultaneously
whoShouldAttend: Software developers looking to learn Docker for application development.
DevOps engineers seeking to understand Docker for environment management and team collaboration.
System administrators interested in using Docker for system management and maintenance.
Individuals interested in learning containerization and system management in situations requiring flexibility and resource efficiency.
prerequisites: Basic knowledge of Linux operating systems.
Proficiency in Command Line Interface (CLI) usage.
participantsWillReceive: One Cloud Servers (VM) per person for training purposes.
Training manuals/documentation.
Lunch and refreshments.
Certification upon completion of the Fundamental Docker course.
Excellent care and attention from instructors and staff.

Unlimited attendance to the Fundamental Docker Workshop (limited to 5 repeat attendees per training session; if you wish to attend the workshop again, please contact our Facebook Page, Line, Email, or other channels to reserve your seat).

outline.title: Docker Compose
descriptions: Workshop 8 - Build image with Docker file

th.title: Modern Web Frontend with React (Next.js - App Router - Typescript)
th.overview: The Modern Web Frontend with React (Next.js - App Router - Typescript) course is a learning experience focused on the basics of developing web applications using ReactJS, a JavaScript library used for building user interfaces. Participants will learn about the React structure, component creation, state management, API integration, and routing in web applications.
objectives: To provide participants with an understanding of the basics of ReactJS and web application development using React.
To empower participants to create and manage various components in web applications using React.
To enable participants to fetch data from APIs and manage the state of the application in the React framework.
whoShouldAttend: Software developers looking to learn about ReactJS and web application development.
Developers with experience in website development who seek to understand the usage of ReactJS.
Individuals interested in learning how to create efficient web applications using ReactJS.
prerequisites: Participants in the course should have basic knowledge of programming with JavaScript.
Participants in the course should also have fundamental knowledge of web application development.
Participants should have a basic understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to better grasp the content.
Preparation of necessary development tools such as Node.js and npm (Node Package Manager) for building and managing React projects.
Ability to use Command Line Interface (CLI) for creating React projects and managing dependencies using npm.
A computer equipped with programming tools such as a Text Editor or Integrated Development Environment (IDE) suitable for React development.
Enthusiasm for learning and collaborating with others during the course. Working with team members helps participants gain valuable experience through knowledge exchange and collaboration.
participantsWillReceive: Training manuals/documentation.
Lunch and refreshments.
Certification upon completion of the Modern Web Frontend with React (Next.js - App Router - Typescript) course.
Excellent care and attention from instructors and staff.

Unlimited attendance to the Modern Web Frontend with React (Next.js - App Router - Typescript) (limited to 5 repeat attendees per training session; if you wish to attend the workshop again, please contact our Facebook Page, Line, Email, or other channels to reserve your seat).
If you are unable to attend the training session this time, you can reschedule your participation according to the training schedule.

outline.title: History of Web Frontend Development
descriptions: The evolution of web application development before the separation of Backend and Frontend.

outline.title: Pros and Cons
descriptions: Advantages and disadvantages of developing web applications with separated Backend and Frontend.

outline.title: System Architecture Overview
descriptions: An overview of current web application design with Backend and Frontend separation, including case studies.

outline.title: ECMAScript and TypeScript
descriptions: Modern JavaScript writing and fundamentals of TypeScript.

outline.title: What is React? And why Next.js?
descriptions: Introduction to React and React-powered frameworks.

outline.title: Project Structure
descriptions: Introduction to the basic structure of Next.js.

outline.title: HTML and JSX
descriptions: Differences and precautions between HTML tags and JSX.

outline.title: Component Concept
descriptions: Explanation of functions and various necessary roles in developing web applications with React
Creating components to separate frequently used parts

outline.title: Tailwind CSS
descriptions: Introduction to basic usage of Tailwind CSS

outline.title: State: A Component's Memory
descriptions: Explanation of useState function and basic usage.

outline.title: Sharing State Between Components
descriptions: Explanation of using State with other components.

outline.title: Next.js Routing
descriptions: Explanation of creating Route Paths in various formats

outline.title: Server Components and Client Components
descriptions: Explanation of differences and usage of Server Components and Client Components

outline.title: Next.js Data Fetching
descriptions: Creating and using Server Actions and Mutations

outline.title: Authentication Flow
descriptions: Explanation of the structure and principles of Authentication systems.

outline.title: Passing Data Deeply with Context
descriptions: Explanation of principles, necessity, and management of complex

outline.title: Error Handling and Middleware
descriptions: Explanation of Error Handling principles in the Next.js framework and Middleware operations

outline.title: Scaling Up with Reducer and Context
descriptions: Explanation of using Reducer and State Action with Context

outline.title: Synchronizing with Effects
descriptions: Explanation of useEffect function and its usage in various formats.

outline.title: Environment Variables and Deploying
descriptions: Explanation of Environment Variables usage and deployment in various formats.
